com.nerjal.json.parser.options

Class ArrayParseOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nerjal.json.parser.options.ArrayParseOptions

  • public class ArrayParseOptions
extends Object

    Stringification options for JsonArray elements.

    Allows to set how many elements should be stringified per line.

    Therefore, it supports multiple values, which are:
    • one element per line
    • a specified number of elements per line
    • all in one line
    Warning! comments bypass the multiple-per-line rule, always being on a new line, and followed by one.
    Author:
    Nerjal Nosk

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat
      Different available formats for JsonArray stringification options

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayParseOptions()
      Instantiates new array stringification options with a default one-per-line format.
      ArrayParseOptions(ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat format)
      Instantiates new array stringification options with the specified format, and a default number of elements per line of 2 if multiple format, 0 otherwise.
      ArrayParseOptions(ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat format, int numPerLine)
      Instantiates new array stringification options with the specified format, and number of elements per line (only used with ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat.MULTIPLE_PER_LINE)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getNumPerLine()
      Returns the number of elements per line as executed during stringification.
      boolean isAllInOneLine()
      Returns whether the options shall make any array stringified with all children elements in one line
      void setFormat(ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat format)
      Sets a new format for the stringification options
      void setNumPerLine(long i)
      Sets a new number of elements per line for the stringification options.
      Format is automatically adapted to the specified number:
      1 -> one per line
      0 or Long.MAX_VALUE -> all inline
      other -> multiple per line

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayParseOptions

        public ArrayParseOptions(ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat format,
                         int numPerLine)
        Instantiates new array stringification options with the specified format, and number of elements per line (only used with ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat.MULTIPLE_PER_LINE)
        Parameters:
        format - the stringification format to use
        numPerLine - the number of element per line if multiple
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if numPerLine is negative

      • ArrayParseOptions

        public ArrayParseOptions(ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat format)
        Instantiates new array stringification options with the specified format, and a default number of elements per line of 2 if multiple format, 0 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        format - the stringification format to use

      • ArrayParseOptions

        public ArrayParseOptions()
        Instantiates new array stringification options with a default one-per-line format.

    • Method Detail

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(ArrayParseOptions.ArrayFormat format)
        Sets a new format for the stringification options
        Parameters:
        format - the stringification options' new format

      • setNumPerLine

        public void setNumPerLine(long i)
                   throws JsonError.IllegalLineElementsNumberException
        Sets a new number of elements per line for the stringification options.
        Format is automatically adapted to the specified number:
        1 -> one per line
        0 or Long.MAX_VALUE -> all inline
        other -> multiple per line
        Parameters:
        i - the new number of elements per line
        Throws:
        JsonError.IllegalLineElementsNumberException - if the given number is negative

      • getNumPerLine

        public long getNumPerLine()
        Returns the number of elements per line as executed during stringification.
        Returns:
        the number of elements stringified per line

      • isAllInOneLine

        public boolean isAllInOneLine()
        Returns whether the options shall make any array stringified with all children elements in one line
        Returns:
        whether all array children elements shall be in one line
